title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2.4 - Executive Order No. 4: Amending Executive Order No. 42, dated October 14, 1970, relating to the procedures for submission and settlement of certain grievances of state employees
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2.4 - Executive Order No. 4: Amending Executive Order No. 42, dated October 14, 1970, relating to the procedures for submission and settlement of certain grievances of state employees

State Regulations
I, Malcolm Wilson, Governor of the State of New York, by
virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws of the State
of New York, do hereby direct by executive order that paragraph (a) of section
six of Executive Order Number 42 [ยง
1.42, supra
], dated October 14, 1970, be amended to read as follows: (a) The provisions of this order shall apply
to employees in the executive branch of the State government: (1)
who are not covered by a collective
agreement between the State and a certified or recognized employee
organization; or
(2)
who are covered
by a collective agreement which accords such employees the right to continue to
process grievances under this order, except that where the provisions of such
agreement conflict with the provisions of this order or with the provisions of
any regulation promulgated by the Grievance Appeals Board pursuant to this
order with respect to the processing of grievances under this order, the
provisions of such agreement shall control. Signed: Malcolm A. Wilson

Dated: February 4, 1974

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
2.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
